list_page_teaser: Not everyone who runs for president wins.  See the images of several recent contenders for this office who did not win, and compare them to the images of the winners in the Presidents gallery.
description_html:
These are images of some candidates who have recently run for President of the United States and lost.

It is important to note that many of the images in this gallery are based on a four-letter-types, and are therefore of 'generic' personalities using fixed percentages.
story_html:
Did one of your favorite candidates recently lose a presidential election? If so, was their personality type more similar to yours than the winner?

Are you someone who thinks those who run as a candidate of one of the two major parties offer no real choice, and that third parties offer the best options? (If so, you might find this gallery particularly enlightening!)

Or do you think this personality type stuff is irrelevant to your politics? Perhaps your voting habits are based strictly a candidate's political party, or their ideology or stance on a specific issue that has nothing to do with these preferences?

My hope is that sharing these images will help you answer these questions for yourself!

image_list.title: Hillary Clinton 2016
image_list.subtitle_html: Presidential Contender, 2008 and 2016
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: A friend who campaigned for Hillary in 2016 helped me create this profile of her.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Hillary's pragmatism.  In Introverts, the dominant trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long horizontal line to represent this.  This trait is evident in her willingness to take 'hawkish' stances with regard to military measures.
image_list.explain_aux: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Hillary's preference for making logical decisions.  In Introverts, the auxiliary trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a vertical line to represent this, because it is more evident than the dominant function.  This trait is evident in her decision to pursue a law degree at Yale University.
image_list.story_intro_html: In contrast to the other spiritual portrait of Hillary Clinton on this site, this portrait is based on ....
image_list.story_html:
In contrast to the other spiritual portrait of Hillary Clinton on this site, this portrait is based on a profile developed by a friend and me, instead of a four-letter type I got from a web site. Therefore, I believe it is more accurate and conveys more information than the other portrait.

In this profile, Hillary's four-letter type is ISTJ, while the other portrait of Hillary shows her as an ESTJ. So as far as the four-letter type is concerned, the only difference is that this one is Introverted.

As an Introvert myself, it is difficult to imagine running for president, and constantly being in the limelight. And it's especially to imagine running against an Extravert like Donald Trump. Keirsey claims that Jefferson and Lincoln were Introverts, but obviously back in their day they were not constantly being hounded by the media, as candidates are today.

Despite this difference, both images exude a similar mood, in that they are both dominated by Green and Yellow. Although I do not yet have a profile for Bernie Sanders, I am sure it would look significantly different from Hillary's, because he is idealistic and passionate.

And indeed, an article at truity.com claims Bernie is an INFJ, an article at personalitypathways.com claims he is an INFP, and an article at theodysseyonline.com claims he is an INFJ or INFP.

So if we believe Bernie is an INFJ or INFP — and that certainly sounds reasonable to me — Blue and Red would dominate his spiritual portrait, and it would definitely exude a much different mood than Hillary's.

It takes a long time to develop one of these profiles, generate the image for it, and explain it all in simple terms! But perhaps if he runs in 2020, I will add Bernie's profile to this site.

To be sure to see his portrait if and when I add it, follow this site on social media or join the SeeOurMinds.com email list!

image_list.title: John McCain (Slate.com)
image_list.subtitle_html: Presidential Contender, 2000 and 2008
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: A frequently-referenced article at slate.com claims that John McCain is an ESTP.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents John's pragmatism.  In Extraverts, the dominant function is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this.  This preference is apparent in his down-to-earth perspective and focus on the real world.
image_list.explain_aux: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents John's preference for making logical decisions.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary function is directed inwardly and is less evident than the dominant function.  This preference is apparent in his ability to survive the horrors of being a prisoner of war in Viet Nam.
image_list.story_intro_html: This article at slate.com claims that John McCain is an ESTP, and that ....
image_list.story_html:
This article at slate.com claims that John McCain is an ESTP, and that sounds reasonable.

Because this portrait is based on a four-letter-type (fixed percentages), it conveys limited information when compared to most of the other portraits on this site, which are based on profiles I develop by hand.

image_list.title: Ralph Nader (Keirsey.com)
image_list.subtitle_html: Presidential Contender, 1972-2008
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: An article on keirsey.com claims that Ralph Nader is an ENFJ.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Red in this spiritual portrait represents Ralph's preference for using his feelings rather than logic to make decisions.  In Extraverts, the dominant function is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this.  This trait is evident in the way he cares more about people than he does for large corporations.
image_list.explain_aux: The Blue in this spiritual portrait represents Ralph's idealism.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary function is directed inwardly and is less evident than the dominant function.  This trait is evident in his vision of a future in which people will be happier and live longer.
image_list.story_intro_html: David Keirsey claims that Ralph Nader is an ENFJ on this page about ENFJs at keirsey.com, and ....
image_list.story_html:
David Keirsey claims that Ralph Nader is an ENFJ on this page about ENFJs at keirsey.com, and this certainly sounds reasonable.

Because this portrait is based on a four-letter-type (fixed percentages), it conveys limited information when compared to most of the other portraits on this site, which are based on profiles developed manually.

image_list.title: Hillary Clinton (Slate.com)
image_list.subtitle_html: Presidential Contender, 2008 and 2016
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Some articles claim that Hillary is an ESTJ, but this may not actually be true.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Hillary's preference for making logical decisions.  In Extraverts, the dominant function is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this.  This trait is evident in her decision to pursue a law degree at Yale University.
image_list.explain_aux: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Hillary's pragmatism.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary function is directed inwardly and is less evident than the dominant function.  This trait is evident in her willingness to take 'hawkish' stances with regard to military measures.
image_list.story_intro_html: This article at slate.com claims that Hillary Clinton is an ESTJ. This article at celebritytypes.com also claims she is an ESTJ, but ....
image_list.story_html:
This article at slate.com claims that Hillary Clinton is an ESTJ. This article at celebritytypes.com also claims she is an ESTJ, but beneath the list of her quotes under her photograph on that page it says there is some disagreement about this. For details, follow the link.

Importantly, the article at celebritytypes.com claims she self-identifies as an Introvert. The other portrait of Hillary on this site, which is based on a profile developed by hand, also shows her as an Introvert, specifically an ISTJ.

Trying to guess someone's type can be difficult — especially when they're Introverted. You are definitely free to form your own conclusions on this topic!

This portrait is based on a four-letter-type (fixed percentages), so it conveys limited information when compared to most of the other portraits on this site, which are based on profiles developed manually. Because it is based on a profile developed manually, the other portrait of Hillary on this site undoubtedly represents her personality more accurately than this one.
